examples: We put many small scraps of material together to make a quilt.

images.alt: Photo of a plate of food scraps.
images.description: Plate of lime rinds, cucumber and orange peels, and the top of an orange pepper.
images.caption: Food scraps can be combined to make something new.

meanings.definition: Present or ready for immediate use.
examples: All the materials available for us to use were on the table.

images.alt: Photo of a store display of backpacks.
images.description: Two rows of backpacks fill a long wall display in a store.
images.caption: Backpacks available to purchase.

meanings.definition: To design or create something that did not exist before.
examples: Alexander Graham Bell invented the first telephone.

images.alt: Photo of a teen holding wires and a lit light bulb.
images.description: A teen sits on a low stool. in front of him is a bag with wires and flat plastic plates. On the ground are headphones, wires, metal plates, and other electronic pieces. The teen holds a light bulb which is glowing. Wires are attached to the bulb and to an object that he holds in his other hand.
images.caption: Anyone with ideas can invent new things.

meanings.definition: To like or want more than another thing.
examples: One class had a lot of people who liked dogs, while the other class had people who preferred cats.

images.alt: Photo of different flavors of ice cream.
images.description: The photo shows a case with long oval containers filled with different colors of ice cream. The container holding the dark brown flavor is half full. The container holding the light brown flavor is also half full. The containers holding the green, orange, white, medium brown, brown, red, yellow, and light yellow flavors are completely full.
images.caption: It looks like the most preferred ice cream here is the dark chocolate ice cream. What flavor do you prefer?

examples: The outcome of the election will be decided after the last vote is counted.

images.alt: Photo of runners on a track.
images.description: Photo showing the finish of a  track race. The runners are moving from left to right. At the far left, one runner is alone, ahead of all other runners. In the middle are four racers crossing the finish line at about the same time. On the far right is one runner, behind all the other runners.
images.caption: The outcome of this race is that Usain Bolt won!

meanings.definition: Bread, cakes, pastries, and similar items of food that are cooked in an oven.
examples: Baked goods include cakes, cookies, pies, and bread. Can you think of other kinds of baked goods?

images.alt: Photo of cookies, muffins, and brownies.
images.description: In the upper right of the photo is a basket filled with flat, rounded cookies. In the middle right is a plate with two small, tan-colored  cakes or muffins, both cut into two pieces. In the lower section of the photo is a basket of the small tan-colored cakes. In the middle left is a basket filled with square, dark brown cakes or brownies. In the upper left is a jar of amber liquid and a stick.
images.caption: Baked goods is a name given to many kinds of baked products.

source.title: Baked goods
source.author: Scott Bauer, U.S. Department of Agriculture

meanings.definition: A wide, deep pot used for boiling liquids, such as water or soup.
examples: The workers poured 40 gallons of maple sap into the large kettle to begin making maple syrup.

images.alt: Photo of cooking pots over a hot flame.
images.description: Photo of large silver cooking vessles resting on grates. Two cooking pots, with covers, are nearest the viewer. A fire burns beneath the pots. In the background are people working near the pots, and others sitting at tables.
images.caption: Covered kettles heating over an open flame.

meanings.definition: a hollow container, usually metal, especially one used to heat liquid.
examples: The workers poured 40 gallons of maple sap into the large metallic cooking vessle and started to boil it down to make maple syrup.

images.alt: Photo of cooking pots over a hot flame.
images.description: Photo of large silver cooking vessles resting on grates. Two cooking pots, with covers, are nearest the viewer. A fire burns beneath the pots. In the background are people working near the pots, and others sitting at tables.
images.caption: Large cooking vessles heating over an open fire.

meanings.definition: A dough of flour, shortening, water, and sugar that is baked and used for pie crusts and other baked goods.
examples: My favorite pastry is apple pie.

images.alt: Photo of pastry in a bakery cabinet.
images.description: This photo shows different types of baked goods arranged on two shelves of a bakery cabinet. On the lower shelf are baked goods of different shapes, including long and braided, round filled with chocolate, and square. On the top shelf are large, round baked goods covered with drizzled frosting, and one that is a single large, wide rectangle.
images.caption: Different types of pastries fill this display case.

examples: One batch of cookie batter produced 24 cookies, while another batch produced 48 cookies.

images.alt: Photo of person using a frying machine.
images.description: Person stands behind a large silver machine. In the foreground are six rows of round tubes, four in each row. The round tubes float in a bubbling liquid.
images.caption: Baker using a machine to produce doughnuts.

examples: Composite benches and boards can be manufactured from recycled plastic.

images.alt: Photo of person using a frying machine.
images.description: Person stands behind a large silver machine. In the foreground are six rows of round tubes, four in each row. The round tubes float in a bubbling liquid.
images.caption: Baker using a machine to produce doughnuts.

meanings.definition: Truly what something is said to be.
examples: After taking the quiz, the teacher showed the class the actual answers.
When the cereal box was empty, my mom replaced it with a new, full box.

meanings.definition: Truly what something is said to be.
examples: I made a genuine home cooked meal for my friends, rather than getting takeout and pretending that I made it.

meanings.definition: to take the place of something else.
examples: We exchanged our empty soda cans for money.
